definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
Lepidoptera (insect order including butterflies 蝶類|蝶类 and moths 蛾類|蛾类)
Hymenoptera (insect order including ants and bees)
elytrum (hardened forewing of Coleoptera beetle, encasing the flight wing)
(bird species of China) Chinese bush warbler (Locustella tacsanowskia)
(bird species of China) Baikal bush warbler (Locustella davidi)
Hemiptera (suborder of order Homoptera, insects including cicadas and aphids)

sentences.english: Set the bird's wings with gold and it will never again soar in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 把黄金系在鸟翅上，鸟儿将永远不能翱翔于天际。

sentences.english: Ten months later, helped by little hooks on its back.
sentences.chinese: 十个月后，在它背上小镰翅的帮助下。

sentences.english: Raptors include Marsh Harrier and Black winged Kite.
sentences.chinese: 猛禽包括沼泽鹞和黑翅鸢。

sentences.english: He took a breath to clear away the cobwebs of the night as the raven flapped away.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了口气吹走昨夜的蜘蛛网，乌鸦随之扑翅飞开。

sentences.english: Butterfly class at rest their wings folded up in back is.
sentences.chinese: 蝶类在休息时它们的翅是合拢起来立于背上。

sentences.english: But anything that does not have fins and scales you may not eat; for you it is unclean.
sentences.chinese: 凡无翅无鳞的都不可吃，是与你们不洁净。

sentences.english: Seminal much line, oblate form, transparent thin coating is provided all round qualitative wide wing.
sentences.chinese: 种子多列，扁圆形，四周具透明膜质宽翅。

sentences.english: Lawmaker urges shark fin trading ban.
sentences.chinese: 中国立法委员呼吁禁止鲨鱼翅交易。

sentences.english: Seeds narrowly winged along angles or transversely squamulose winged.
sentences.chinese: 种子狭翅沿着棱或横向的具小鳞片状翅。

sentences.english: Life is a broken- winged bird that cannot fly.
sentences.chinese: 生命就像断翅的鸟儿不能飞翔。

sentences.english: The effects of traditional processing technology on color of braised chicken wings were investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了传统卤鸡翅各个加工工艺步骤对其颜色的影响。

sentences.english: The insect is small, yellow brown, the former central wings have auburn horizontal grain article 2.
sentences.chinese: 雄虫较小，淡黄褐色，前翅中部有赤褐色横纹二条。

sentences.english: When mosquitoes fly, their wing would produce continuous wingbeat sounds.
sentences.chinese: 蚊虫飞翔时，翅上下拍打会形成连续的翅振音。

sentences.english: Areoles spaced far apart in notches along wings or angles.
sentences.chinese: 小窠在翅或角上的凹缺上相隔较远地分布。

definition: wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
to fan/to flap/to incite/to instigate (a strike etc)
